content.webTitle: Power plants are warned of winter gas cuts

fields.headline: Power plants are warned of winter gas cuts
fields.bodyText: British gas supplies are lower than last year with power stations and big industrial users facing cuts in the event of a severe winter, according to National Grid's energy outlook. Supplies to homes would be maintained even in the face of the harsh conditions encountered only once every 50 years. If gas supplies for power stations had to be reduced, electricity generation could be sustained by using coal, nuclear and oil-fired generators. A number of organisations have expressed concern about supplies this winter as reliance on imported gas increases with the fall in North Sea output.
